Source: TODO.md

Refresh package documentation.

Missing any major PLS algorithm? CPPLS (Canonical Powered PLS) OPLS / O2-PLS (Orthogonal PLS) Bridge / Continuum PLS Primal sparse PLS (sPLS, Chun & Keleş) Robust PLS (RSIMPLS / M-estimator reweighting)

  1. Enable soft thresholding • Sparse KPLS: implement _1 on weights (prox/coord-descent) with orthogonalization and early stopping by explained covariance. No—soft thresholding is not applied component-by-component during extraction in the current implementation. pls_fit() only calls .maybe_threshold() after each backend solver returns the completed fit. When coef_threshold is provided, .maybe_threshold() simply hands the final model to pls_threshold(), so any sparsity is imposed once the full set of loadings/coefficients has already been computed. pls_threshold() itself performs a hard (not soft) global cutoff by zeroing coefficients whose absolute value is below the supplied threshold; there is no iterative, per-component shrinkage that would maintain orthogonality at each PLS deflation step. Because the shrinkage is a post-hoc hard threshold, components are produced by the standard solvers without intermediate soft-threshold adjustments.

TODO: Next Algorithms & Plumbing

  1. CPPLS (Canonical Powered PLS) • API: algorithm=“cppls”, args power ∈ [0,1], class_weights=NULL. • Dense path: compute criterion on XtX/XtY with power, SIMPLS-style orthogonalisation. • bigmem path: reuse streamed cross-products; no change to scores streaming. • Predict: same linear form via W %*% solve(P’W); store power in fit. • Stubs: • R: run_dense_cppls(), run_bigmem_cppls(). • C++ (optional helper): cpp_cppls_from_cross(XtX, XtY, ncomp, power, tol). • Tests: parity vs pls::cppls on small data; class weight smoke test.

  2. OPLS / O2-PLS (Orthogonal PLS) • API: algorithm=“opls”, args n_orth=1L (OPLS), and algorithm=“o2pls”, args n_orth_x, n_orth_y. • Dense: loop: (a) predictive t, (b) orthogonal t⊥ extraction, (c) deflation; keep SIMPLS kernels for predictive part. • bigmem: express deflation with projection matrices on XtX/XtY; keep streamed scoring unchanged. • Predict: expose type=“scores_denoised” using X-orthogonal removal; default stays response. • Stubs: • R: run_dense_opls(), run_bigmem_opls(), run_dense_o2pls(), run_bigmem_o2pls(). • C++: optional helpers for orthogonal projector updates from cross-products. • Tests: OPLS predictive vs SIMPLS on data with structured X-orth noise; O2-PLS symmetry check.

  3. Bridge / Continuum PLS • API: algorithm=“bridgepls”, arg alpha ∈ [0,1] (0≈PCR, 1≈PLS). • Dense/bigmem: solve eigen on (1−alpha) XtX + alpha * XtY * t(XtY) (or equivalent), then SIMPLS orthogonalisation. • Predict: same linear form. • Stubs: run_dense_bridgepls(), run_bigmem_bridgepls(), cpp_bridgepls_from_cross(…). • Tests: recover PCR at alpha≈0, PLS at alpha≈1; path continuity.

  4. Primal sparse PLS (sPLS; Chun & Keleş) • API: algorithm=“spls”, args lambda1 (L1), lambda2 (ridge), maxit, tol, early_stop. • Dense: coordinate-descent / proximal on w with unit-norm constraint; SIMPLS-style deflation; start with PLS1, extend to PLS2. • bigmem: keep dense for now; later port scoring stream once stable. • Predict: unchanged; store sparsity pattern. • Stubs: run_dense_spls(), (later) run_bigmem_spls(), cpp_spls_step(…). • Tests: coefficient sparsity, recovery under synthetic sparsity, stability vs mixOmics.

  5. Robust PLS (RSIMPLS / M-estimator) • API: algorithm=“robust_simpls”, args psi=c(“huber”,“tukey”), c_tune, maxit, tol. • Dense/bigmem: observation weights in SIMPLS/NIPALS loop; robust reweight/deflate. • Predict: unchanged. • Stubs: run_dense_robust_simpls(), run_bigmem_robust_simpls(), cpp_weighted_simpls_from_cross(…). • Tests: outlier contamination sims (breakdown behavior).

  6. Multinomial kernel-logit PLS (extension of klogitpls) • API: algorithm=“kmlogitpls”, args class_weights, maxit, tol, alternations. • Dense: KPLS → IRLS (multinomial); optional alternations to refresh T. • bigmem: reuse RKHS block MVMs; predict with streamed cross-kernel. • Stubs: run_dense_kmlogitpls(), run_bigmem_kmlogitpls(), cpp_irls_multinomial(…). • Tests: simple K>2 toy spiral / blobs; probability simplex & accuracy.

⸻

Cross-cutting tasks • predict.big_plsr(): add branches for new algorithms where needed (OPLS scores_denoised; multinomial probs; sPLS same). • Streaming: ensure all new branches either (a) reuse XtX/XtY accumulation; or (b) reuse existing RKHS block ops. • Options: • Document bigPLSR.simpls.solve, bigPLSR.simpls.cross, bigPLSR.stream.block_align. • Benchmarks: • Dense CPU: show tri/chol vs solve diffs; memory vs speed. • bigmem: scores=‘none’ vs ‘r’; effect of chunk_size. • Vignettes: • Add “OPLS/O2-PLS in bigPLSR”, “CPPLS & Continuum PLS”, “Sparse PLS”, “Robust PLS”. • Namespace: • Keep new C++ helpers internal; expose only via .Call entry points used by R runners. • Tests: • Parity vs pls where applicable; invariance to column scaling/centering where expected; streaming/dense parity checks.
